Whatever he sees gives him an idea and he cuts between two buildings rather than following the basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Bad Arabs come running down the Alley with the basket between them.  Suddenly, Indy's whip flashes out sending both Arabs and the basket tumbling.  Indy steps into view his .45 trained on the sprawled Arabs, and looks at the basket.  The top has come flying off and the contents hav clattered onto the cobblestone:   inside is not Marion, but a load of contraband pistols, rifles and ammo.  Indy advancing on the trembling Bad Arabs with an ugly look when suddenly he hears Marion scream around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy rounds the corner and is immediately driven back by machine gun fire.  Taking cover, he gets quick, inter- mittent glimpses of this scene:  At the far corner of the large, deserted square is a canvas-covered truck.  Two Bad Arabs are hurrying toward is with a large rattan bas- ket between them, Marion screaming inside.  A German Agen is covering their retreat with a machine gun from the cab of the truck.  Indy runs up to see the rattan basket being heaved into the back of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Indy cannot see is that the basket lands among an ominous load of German munitions, dynamite and firearms. The truck immediately peels out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The German Agent has stopped firing in order to drive.  H floors it, aiming for a street at the corner of the squar Indy uses the lull to take careful aim at the German Agen profile and fire off three careful shots.  The German Age is hit, blasted dead against the steering wheel.  The spe ing truck swerves, hits a wall, rolls over and explodes i an enormous, multi-leveled eruption as its contents ignit Several surrounding buildings are leveled. Indy, blown back across the square, looks on, astounded a horror-stricken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark, smoke-filled den on iniquity.  The patrons, almost all fearsome Arabs, sit in small shadowy groups around the room.  Indy stands at the bar finishing off a fifth of bourbon.  He is drunk.  The ARAB BARTENDER places a new bottle of expensive bourbon in front of him. Indy eyes is queerly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gentleman in the corner sent it. He would like you to join him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't even look) Too bad.  I'm drinking alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Arab Bartender does a take, looking at the three, tough GERMAN HENCHMEN who have surrounded Indy from out of the smoke, their hands stuffed in bulging trenchcoat p ets.  Indy notices them now with a bleary glance.  He decides he's in no shape to kill or be killed and moves with them across the room, taking his bottle with him. The Arab patrons take this in and mind their own business The occupant of the smoke-shrouded corner table becomes visible only as Indy -eaches there:  it is Emile Belloq. He is drinking wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belloq.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, Dr. Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ought to kill you right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was not I who brought the girl into this dirty business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy knows its true; that's what's tearing him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, please, before you fall down.  We can behave as civilized people.  I'm afraid it will be your last opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy sits, glancing at the German Henchmen, who settle nearby, just out of earshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a very private place for a murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) These Arabs will not interfere in the white man's business.  They do not care if we kill each other off. (takes a sip of wine, refers to it) Terribly difficult finding a decent vintage here.  You were quite vig- orous in Shanghai.  Unfortunately, our friend the Wild Boar had taken the precaution of making several copies of the piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy registers this as he takes a drink.  Belloq watches him with disdainful amusement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How odd that is should end this way for us, after so many...stimulating encounters.  I almost regret it. Where shall I find a new adversary so close to my own level?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try the local sewer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you despise me.  We always hate in others that which we most fear in ourselves.  And you and I are very much alike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're getting nasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have always done the same kind of work.  Our methods have not differed as much as you pretend.  I am a sha- dowy reflection of you.  But it would have taken only a nudge to make you the same as me, to push you out of the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a certain amount of truth to this; the recognitio of it flickers across Indy's bleary eyes.  Belloq sees it there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it to be true!  How nice. And how ironic the timing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belloq leans forward, eyes shining, voice suddenly differ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you realize that the Ark is? (very intense) It's a transmitter.  A radio for talking to God!  And now it is within my grasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your boss, Der Fuhrer? I thought he was waiting to take possession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belloq glances into the gloom at the German Henchmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quieter) When the time is right.  When I am finished with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope your friends are patient. Dangerous work, Belloq.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Very.  You may consider your- self fortunate that your involve- ment concludes here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, did you get away with the idol?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (negative) I was lucky to get away with my life.  The Hovitos proved quite narrow-minded about the whole matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy takes a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, if it's God you want to talk to, maybe I can arrange it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) You have not changed.  But, please, do not reach for your weapon until you are ready to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door of the bar slams open and all nine of SALLAH'S CHILDREN scamper in and over to a surprised Indy.  Two of the smallest hop into his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Indy, we have been looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come home now, Uncle. Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the Arab patrons of the bar take an intense in- terest in the situation, shifting their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Yes, I'll come now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy stands up.  The German Henchmen and poised.  Belloq eyes the Arab patrons and signals for the Henchmen to rel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time, Indiana Jones, it will take more than children to save you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children usher Indy out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy climbs into the cab of Sallah's truck with a smiling Sallah as the children pile into the back.  Sallah pulls

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we would find you there. (indicating the kids) Better than the United States Ma- rines, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Thanks you. (grave) Marion's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I know.  I am sorry. (pause) More reason than ever to beat the bastards. (he touches Indy) Life goes on, Indy. (indicates the kids again) There is the proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy looks back there, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have much to tell you, Indy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fayah brings in a tray of food and puts it on the table. The bowl of dates is in one corner.  As Fayah leaves the room, the Monkey slips out of Sallah's lap and disappears under the table.  Indy leans over the food tray, his hand hovering over the dates.  But he chooses some cheese and bread instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they made the calculation in the map room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods vigorously) This morning.  Belloq and the boss German, Shliemann.  When they came out of the map room, we were given a new spot in which to dig...out away from the camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resigned) The Well of the Souls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sallah nods, moves to the food.  He picks up a date, then changes his mind and drops it, taking a bunch of grapes instead.  Indy picks up a chicken leg in one hand and a date in the other, his mind distracted.  Fayah enters the room just in time to see Indy flip the date high into the air and try to catch it in his mouth.  It bounces off his chin and falls to the floor.  Indy looks sheepishly a Fayah.  Fayah picks up the fallen date and puts it in the dirty ash tray she is now removing.  Amir speaks in a slow, raspy voice without looking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come.  Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men go and huddle over the old man.  The Monkey peeks up over the edge of the table at the array of food. He picks up a date and disappears below the table.  Amir points to some markings on the lower part of the headpiec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a warning...not to disturb the Ark of the Covenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just want I need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Monkey's paw comes up over the edge of the table and grabs another date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout the height of the staff? Did Belloq get it off of there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...it is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy, nervous, goes back to the food tray, picks up anoth date.  When he turns back to the men, the Monkey's paw grabs another date. We see the headpiece in closeup on the table.  Amir's cro fingers trace a line of markings along the bottom section to the break in the piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says it is...ten jamirs high...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About seventy-five inches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!  I am not finished...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amir's finger moves across the break as the markings con- tinue on the sun medallion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) "And one jamir to honor the Hebrew God whose Ark this is."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy, still holding the date, exchanges a long look with Sallah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said their top section was blank. Are you absolutely sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sallah nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belloq's staff is seven and a half inches short.  They're digging in the wrong spot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sallah and Indy begin to laugh.  Amir gives them a glance and returns to his wine.  Sallah leans over and kisses th old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Amir) A home run, my friend, grand slam! (to Indy) We have a saying--"A little luck is better than much smartness."  Indy, pardner, you are very lucky fellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy hoots.  Then he takes the data in his hand and flips it high in the air.  He opens his mouth to catch it, but it doesn't come down.  He has inadvertently thrown it int a bowl of a hanging lamp.  This makes the men laugh even harder. Indy goes over and picks up another date.  He turns laugh ing to Sallah and doesn't see as the Monkey's paw comes u slowly, takes another date and begins to withdraw.  Sudde ly the paw is stricken with palsy and the unseen Monkey goes into its death throws.  Sallah watches the paw as though hypnotized.  Finally the paw slips from sight and we hear a solid THUMP! on the floor.  Sallah walks around the table and looks at the floor.  The Monkey lies dead among a mess of date pits. Indy is in a happy world of his own.  He throws his date high in the air.  He positions himself under it and waits for it to drop in.  Here it comes.  Right on target.  As it's about to disappear into Indy's mouth, Sallah's hand flashes in and grabs it.  Indy looks mystified and disap- pointed.  Sallah motions toward the dead Monkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad dates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two old trucks come down a narrow mountain road and onto the flat surface of the desert. Further out into the desert, the one in the lead, Sallah' truck, stops and the second one, Omar's truck, pulls up beside it.  There are half dozen Arab Diggers in Omar's truck.  Indy, dressed as an Arab, gets out of the cab of Sallah's truck and moves over to confer with OMAR, anothe old friend.  They point off into the desert and reach som conclusion.  Indy gives him a pat on the back;  Omar turn off the road and drives into the desert with his workers. Indy hops back in the cab of Sallah's truck with Sallah. As they move down the road we see that the back of the truck holds three other Arab Diggers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy and Sallah are lying in classic shouting fashion at the top of the rise looking down on the Tanis Digs.  Down behind them, Sallah's truck is parked with the three Arab Diggers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God!  They aren't kidding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT HE SEES.  The Tanis Digs are laid out below like a painting.  Trucks, bulldozers, Arab workers and German supervisors are everywhere.  The excavations themselves are extensive and somewhat random-holes have been dug and then abandoned, foundations and passageways unearthed and then deserted.  Beyond the main digs, a crude airstri has been created.  Sallah points to what appears to be a mound of dirt with a hole in it near the center of the activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!  That is the map room!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time does the sun hit the map?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just after eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't got much time.  Where are the Germans digging for the Well of the Souls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sallah points out into the desert a short way beyond the main area of activity.  The desert turns to sand dunes out there, the surface undulating into the distance. Several trucks and men are out there and a bulldozer is lumbering noisily toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sallah's truck drives through the camp, one of the Arab Diggers at the wheel.  Indy and Sallah are in the back an look just like the other two Arab Diggers.  Sallah's truck does behind a tent and when it appears on the other side, Indy and Sallah are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy and Sallah move stealthily among the tents.  Indy ca ries a smooth wooden staff almost seven feet tall.  They stop between two tents and look across a path at the en- trance to the map room.  What appeared to be a mound of dirt is actually the roof on the ancient building.  The hole/entrance is a five-foot square skylight.  Indy looks around, then walks casually to the edge of the hole and looks inside.  Sallah joins him, producing a length of rope from his robes.  Indy drops the staff into the un- seen map room as Sallah  ties the rope around on oil drum When it's secure, Indy wastes no time disappearing down it into the map room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy is down the twenty feet to the floor of the room in seconds.  He tugs on the rope and it immediately gets pul up.  Indy looks around with real wonder and excitement. The room is lovely, with elaborate wall carvings and fres coes, all lit by the bright stream of sunlight flooding in from above.  This beam of light leads Indy's eye to the far end, and the room's truly remarkable feature: bui into the floor in meticulous relief is a miniature stone model of the ancient city of Tanis.  Already, the sunligh has worked its way down the far wall and is edging onto the miniature of the city.  On the floor, to the skylight side of the miniature, is an elaborate line created by embedded mosaic tiles.  The evenly spaced slots in the li each accompanied by a symbol of a time of year, are for t base of the staff.  Indy pulls the headpiece from his rob it has been welded together--and reaches for the staff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An extremely nervous Sallah has the gathered rope in his hands and is trying to appear casual as he inches back to ward the oil drum.  There is now a good bit of activity going on up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  You, the skinny one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sallah jumps about three feet.  The JEEP GERMAN is standi in an open space ten yards away looking at Sallah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you.  What are you doing there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sallah gestures his innocence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well bring that rope over here, you cur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jeep German starts back toward his major concern: his jeep is stuck in some sand beyond the next tent. Some Arab Workers are trying in vain to budge it.  Now another German has backed his truck up to it.  Sallah can think of nothing to do expect obey.  With a worried glance at the map room, be begins untying the rope from the oil drum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy is examining the results of Belloq's work.  Red pain marks one of the miniature buildings in the layout and a white calibrated tape has been strung from that building back to a miniature of the map room.  Now Indy begins ex- amining the mosaic base line for the staff.  Sunlight has moves further down across the miniature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sallah watches nervously as his precious rope is pulled taut between the pulling truck and the stuck jeep.  He doesn't notice that he has chosen to stand next to a larg steaming kettle of food until--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring us some of that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the kettle.  Sallah looks frantically from the rope, back to the skylight of the map room, to the kettle of food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, idiot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sallah picks up some serving pieces and gets to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment has arrived.  Even the tension of the circum- stances cannot distract Indy from the purity of what he is about to do.  All his calculations are adjustments com plete, Indy takes the Staff of Ra and places it--CLINK!-- in the right depression on the base line.  This is as act and exciting a moment as any archeologist can dream of and, at heart, that is exactly what Indy is.  The sunligh catches the very top of the headpiece and moves within a fraction of an inch of the tiny hole in its sun. The edge of the sunlight moving across the miniature city is still a good two feet beyond the spot Belloq has settl on.  And now that line of light is broken by the shadow of an ornate sun at the top of the staff. Indy's face reflects his concentration.  And then his immense pleasure.  He sees what he came for. Out of the miniature city, one small building is being lit by a tiny beam of sunlight in the center of the sha- dow of the metal sun.  And by some trick of ancient artis try, this one building responds to the sunlight like none of the others.  The golden light permeates it: it seems to glow.  The building is in a direct line with Belloq's- all the Frenchman's other calculations were right--but it is a foot and a half beyond it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sallah, sweating profusely, has finished serving the line of Breakfasting Germans and now heads back to replace the kettle and get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water.  Bring us water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy is on his knees at the miniature city, a special tap measure in his hand.  Indy has the tape strung from Bello mistaken spot to his own correct spot.  He gets his readi leaps up and crosses to the erect staff.  He pulls the he piece off the staff and hides it in his robes.  He quickl breaks the wooden staff in two and throws the pieces behi a pile of debris.  Then he moves quickly to beneath the skylight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stage whisper) Sallah. (he waits, then louder) Sallah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More waiting.  Nothing.  Indy looks around for some alter native means of escape.  The room doesn't offer any.  He looks up at the skylight again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudest) Sallah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long pause.  Then something comes down.  A makeshift rope.  Really just a bunch of clothing tied together-- tunics, robes, pants.  But what we see first and most prominently, the first section of Indy's escape rope, is a bright Nazi flag.  Indy beams and climbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy sticks his head out the skylight, sees it clear and flops his body out.  Sallah, crouching behind the oil drum, immediately starts pulling in the makeshift rope.  Sallah stuffs the rope in the oil drum and the two men begin waking toward some tents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you!  More water over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sallah glances at Indy, Then hurries back in that direc- tion.  The Hungry German focuses on Indy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't you at the digs?  Come here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy bows in wild subservience and hurries off in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling after him, irritated) No, dummkopf, I said come!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy hustles between the tents.  Up ahead, two German Officers stop to talk, blocking his exit.  He moves a- long the side of one of the tents until he finds an opening and slips inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy finds himself in a tent set up for rather comfort- able living.  He has just started to cross it when he hears a loud, excited grunting.  He turns toward the soun In the corner, tied to a chair and gagged is Marion. Indy rushes to her, snatches the gag from her mouth and embraces her.  They kiss, deep and long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I though you were dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were throwing me around like a rag doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must have switched baskets. Thank god for that!  Bless those bastards.  Have they hurt you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Not since I got here.  They just asked about you--what you knew. The Frenchman's got the hot's for me. I've been playing that along.  Oh, Indy, get me out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy pulls out a knife and then stops suddenly, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting the knife away) I have to leave you here for a little while.  I know where the Ark is.  If I take you out of here they'll start combing the place for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder) Cut me loose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your voice down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) I said get me out of--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy pops the gag back in her mouth.  Her eyes widen in fury and she grunts obscenities at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you don't know how glad I am to see you.  And I don't like do- ing this.  But the whole thing will be shot if you don't just sit here quietly.  They haven't hurt you in the last twenty-four hours, they aren't going to start now.  I'll be back to get you in no time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her forehead, jumps up and hurries out of the tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the digs behind them, Indy and Sallah run up to the ridge of the dune and over the top.  At the bottom of the far side, Omar's truck is parked.  Omar and his men are waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This new spot gives Indy a higher, better view of the whole scene.  Indy is using a surveyor's instrument to take a reading-- WHAT HE SEES.  Looking through the instrument, Indy gets a line from the map room through the site where the Nazis are digging in the dunes to a spot several dunes over. We focus on that virgin spot of well-hidden sand as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omar's truck is parked at the stop just viewed from afar. Dunes rise on either side.  One of Omar's men has been posted as a lookout up on a ridge.  Everybody else--Indy, Sallah, Omar, and his men--have begun digging for the Wells of the Souls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAME SCENE, NIGHT.  They continue to dig furiously, all of them drenched in sweat.  The hole has grown but this is slow, back-breaking work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belloq, SHLIEMANN the ranking Nazi, and Shliemann's Aide, GOBLER, come into the tent, which is full of charts and maps, drawings of the Ark, radio equipment, liquor and food.  The men have been out digging for the Well all day.  They are tired, discouraged, testy.  In all matters Gobler shows his alliance with Shliemann against Belloq with small looks and body language.  The Frenchman has disappointed them and he is feeling the isolation of a scapegoat.  Belloq gets himself a drink as Shliemann towe off his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cautioned you about being prema- ture with that communique to Berlin. Archeology is not an exact science. If does not adhere to time schedules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fuhrer is not a patient man.  He demands constant reports and he ex- pects progress.  You led me to be- lieve--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  I have made no promises. I said only that it looked very favorable.  Perhaps the Ark will still be found in an adjoining chamber.  Based on the informa- tion in our possession, my cal- culations were correct.  Perhaps some bit of evidence still eludes us.  Perhaps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps the girl can help us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belloq shoots him an angry look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My feeling exactly.  She was in possession of the original piece for years.  She may know much. (really evil) If properly motivated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you, she knows nothing use- ful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm surprised to find you squeamish. That is not your reputation.  But it needn't concern you.  I have the perfect man for this kind of work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shliemann signals Gobler, who steps outside the tent a moment, calls someone and then reappears.  Belloq looks warily at the entrance.  After a moment Belzig enters, reeking villiany.  When his eyes find Shliemann, his superior, he snaps a crisp "Heil, Hitler!" at him, hold- ing his palm rigid a long time, exposing a burned scar in the prefect shape of the sun medallion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the eerie conjunction of moonlight and torchlight, Ind and the other men step back in awe of their discovery: there, flush with the bottom of their pit, is a heavy stone entry door to an underground chamber.  Special pry- ing tools are produced.  With two men assigned to each of the two long tools, they work in unison to open the vault They open it a foot and the other men rush in to flop the heavy door completely open.  Down inside, only blackness. The men quickly prostrate themselves around the edge of the entry to look inside.  Indy and Sallah each take a torch and hold them down the hole. WHAT THEY SEE.  The Well of the Souls is a spooky chamber thirty feet deep.  The walls are covered with hieroglyphi and carvings.  The roof is supported intermittently by stone pillars, the closest of which hits the roof very ne the entry hole.  The Well is quite large; as Indy and Sal wave their torches, more and more of the room is revealed Now the far end of the chamber comes into view.  There is a stone altar down there and on this elaborated carved platform is a stone chest, big enough to enclose the Lost Ark and protect it from the ravages of time.  This altar appears to be the only place on the floor of the Well tha is not covered by a strange, dark carpet of some kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ark must be in that stone case. What's that gray stuff all over the floor--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks off realizing exactly what that carpet is.  He blanches.  Indiana Jones blanches. Indy drops his torch to the floor of the Well.  This is answered by the most horrific HISSING imaginable. WHAT HE SEES.  That think dark carpet is moving.  It's alive.  It's thousands and thousands of deadly poisonous snakes--Egyptian asps.  And the only thing that seems ca- pable of avoiding this venomous groundcover is the altar. The snakes ebb and flow near it, but never encroach on it as though repelled by some invisible force. Indy shakes his head and talks to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why snakes?  Why did it have to be snakes?  Anything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment of this, he stops.  He gathers his energy and resolve and gets back to the task.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asps.  Very dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Indy's torch had landed is a circle of snake-free floor.  The snakes hate the flame; they stay away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of torches.  And oil.  I want a landing strip down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen torches have been dropped to the floor of the chamber, combining to make a good-sized clear zone.  Smok begins to fill the room.  Several canisters of oil have been lowered into this space.  Now, a large wooden crate is lowered slowly by rope.  Rope handles are attached to each end of the crate. Up at the hole, Indy gives Sallah a reassuring pat, takes a breath, and swings carefully onto a rope hanging from the hole.  Despite his care, he swings a bit and his feet hit the stone pillar which is so near the entry.  Surpris ingly, the pillar catually moves a bit, showering a light rain of crumbled stone to the floor below. Indy lands on the floor of the Well.  He looks at the alt over a sea of undulating death.  He picks up an oil canis and splashes two parallel lines of oil and lights them. path six feet wide begins to open to the altar.  Behind Indy, Sallah comes quickly down the rope. We begin to INTERCUT all the action in the Well from here on with insert shots of the snakes outside the flames. Snakes and snakes.  We see: snakes piled and entwined six inches deep; mother snakes laying snake eggs; snake eggs hatching little snakes; snakes cannibalizing other snakes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belloq has been talking to the still-bound Marion.  He has removed her gag.  He is impatient, angry, uncomfort- able.  Caught between two forces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, you make a mistake.  If you would just give me something to placate them.  Some bit of informa- tion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear to you, I know nothing more. I have no loyalty to Jones.  He's brought me only trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to believe her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot control them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marion's frightened look shifts suddenly to the entrance of the tent.  There are new arrivals there--Shliemann, Gobler and Belzig.  Belzig carries a black leather case. He steps forward and smiles at Marion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We meet again, Fraulein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is just beginning to lighten over the dunes to the east, making dangerously obvious the thin column of smoke rising from the entrance to the Well.  Omar and his men are peering through the smoke down into the Well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy and Sallah are on the altar.  Pushing together with all their strength, the heavy stone top of the protective chest begins to slide away.  Indy and Sallah exchange sli wary but very excited looks, then continue to push.  As t Ark begins to be exposed, the air seems to almost vibrate to become electrostatically charged.  We hear what sounds like a low HUM.  The sea of snakes around the altar draws back further from this presence. As the top of the stone chest is pushed completely off an slams down beside it, we see THE LOST ARK OF THE COVENANT It is awesomely beautiful, breathtaking.  4 feet long, 2.5 feet wide and 2.5 feet high.  It's height, however, i increased by the two sculptured gold angels mounted facin each other on the top.  Though the body of the Ark is aca cia wood, it has been overlaid with gold.  An elaborate gold crown surrounds the top edge and gold carrying rings are attached to each corner. Sallah is mesmerized by the sight.  His hand starts to reach out and touch one of the angels, but Indy grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch it!  Never touch it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wooden crate stands open next to the stone chest.  No Indy extracts the wooden poles from its rings and begins fitting them through the rings in the Ark.  This takes some maneuvering by the two men, but soon they are able to lift the Ark clear of the stone chest and into the wooden crate.  They extract the poles, fasten the top of the crate and stick the poles through the rings of the wooden crate.  They start back toward the space under the hole. The fire strips have begun to dwindle, as have some of the torches.  The snakes move slowly in toward the clear spaces.  Indy and Sallah eye them nervously as they hurry along with their heavy load.  Under the hole, they hurrie ly attach ropes to the wooden crate and it is pulled up. Indy's concentration is on the tide of snakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up!  Why did it have to be snakes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sallah takes the next rope and climbs quickly out of the Well.  Indy has picked up a torch and now throws it at a pool of snakes who are too close for his comfort.  He tur and takes hold of the exit rope.  He gives it a first tug and it falls down into the Well, landing partly beyond th ring of fire where is instantly disappears in a tangle of angry, hissing asps.  Indy looks up at the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiling down at him from the perimeter of the entry are Belloq, Shliemann and Gobler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, Dr. Jones, whatever are you doing in such a nasty place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belloq and the Germans laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you fellows come down here?  I'll show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you, my friend. (he glances around him) I think we are all very comfortable up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight is flooding this tableau:  Sallah, Omar and his men are being held at bay by ten armed Nazis.  The wooden crate sits safely nearby.  Belzig and another Nazi have the gagged Marion held in their rough grasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (down to Indy) After all these years, it is most considerate of you to aid me in this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Belloq speaks, Shliemann exchanges a look with Belzig. Belzig smiles and takes the gag from Marion's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shliemann smiles down at Indy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid we must be going now, Dr. Jones.  Our prize is awaited in Berlin. But I do not wish to leave you down in that awful place... (he give a sign) ...all alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belzig and the Nazi move Marion to the hole and, to Bello surprise, push her in.  Marion falls thirty feet screamin Indy drops his torch, braces, and catches her!  Her weigh knocks him to the ground, almost into the snakes.  She looks around at the snakes, clinging to him more desper- ately as he struggles to his feet trying to unload her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't put me down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up at the hole, there's plenty of dissension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl was mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is of no use to us.  Only our mission for the Fuhrer matters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shliemann glances meaningfully around at the other Nazis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder sometimes, Monsieur, if you have that clearly in mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belloq feels how much he is the outsider, his own vulner- ability.  He backs down with the wisdom of survival.  He turns to look down at Indy and Marion.  His manner is gal lant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, mademoiselle. (a pause, then with respect) Indiana Jones...adieu!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belloq and the others step back from the hole and unseen Nazis slam the heavy stone door into place.  Marion screa Her scream is accomanied by-- A huge WHOOSH!  as air is sucked out and the chamber is s ed.  Half of the torches still burning go out with the so The remaining torches continue to extinguish at punctuati intervals throughout the following action and the snakes immediately flood into the newly-darkened spaces.  Indy puts Marion down and snatches up two burning torches.  He hands one to Marion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't panic.  There's plenty of time for that later.  Wave that at any- thing that slithers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy holds his torche out like a lantern and begins a slo 360o turn, his eyes peering into the gloom, examining eve inch of wall and ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just watch the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reminded of the encroaching snakes, Marion waves her torc at the nearest edge of their circle.  She looks faint.  I dy continues his slow turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you're doing, do it faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he spots something) There!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His head whips around, looking at the pillars around the room.  He sees what he wants.  He grabs one of the oil canisters, looks back to the spot on the wall he's chosen and splashes oil on the floor in that direction, then lig it.  A path opens toward that wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marion is frozen in her spot.  Indy drags her after him. He splashes oil the rest of the way to the wall.  It ligh and Indy pulls Marion over to the wall.  He pours the re- maining oil in a circle around them, creating a safe zone there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing him) Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back in a minute.  We're going through this wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marion looks at the wall, which looks like all the rest to her.  She thinks he's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep your eyes open and get ready to run.  No matter what happens to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked) What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late.  Indy runs back through the path of flames to the center of the room.  Snakes strike as his flying heel Indy reaches the base of the pillar which he touched brie on his original descent.  He uses his torch to clear away the scattered snakes climbing on it, then pulls out his whip.  He draws it back, then wraps is solidly around the pillar 15 feet up.  With the torch in his mouth, he begins climbing the pillar.  It moves ominously under his weight. The last two torches still burning on the floor go out. Now the only light in the chamber is provided by the torc held by Indy and Marion and the dwindling oil flames.  Sn move in and surround the base of Indy's pillar.  The path between Marion and the center of the room is overrun.  Th circle of flame around Marion is dying down.  She looks b yond it with terror-widened eyes, then up through the in- creasing smoke at the distant Indy. Near the top of the pillar, Indy's hands strain along his taut whip, which he has moves higher. A snake slithers into view there, inches from Indy's straining face.  Indy turns his head so the torch in his mouth can burn it.  Th snake falls from the pillar.  Indy's torch is dwindling. Indy works his body around so that he in on the side of the pilar away from Marion.  The pillar moves, showering dust.  Indy looks at the chamber wall five feet away, tak a breath and swings his legs up against it.  He is now braced between pillar and wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Where are you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snakes are moving in force up the pillar toward Indy's dwindling torch.  Indy grasps the pillar for dear life, grimaces with exertion and pushes against the wall with all he's got.  The pillar begins to break loose of the ceiling, then stops.  Indy's eyes are on the torch.  It is just a spot of flame now.  Snakes are sliding up to- ward his hands.  Indy again pushes against the wall and the torch falls out of his mouth. The pillar goes!  In the dim light, we see it fall like a tree directly at Marion.  Indy rides it down.  The top hits the wall three feet from a cringing Marion and smash through to a black chamber beyond. Indy flies off into the darkness.  Gone.  Marion clutches her torch at the black hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy!  Where are you?!  Please Lord!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a moment that seems an eternity, then Indy ap- pears like an apparition out of the void.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her and helps her over the remains of the wall into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The winding  string of connected chambers is revealed to them only a few feet at a time as their torch lights the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snakes...are they here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess not.  I think I'd be dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where you're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank god.  Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They round a corner and flush a covey of bats.  Marion screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do that.  It scares me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marion gives him a look.  They round a corner and begin a walk through a maze of chambers that present for their inspection:  moldering mummies and stacked saracophagi; a room decorated with a thousand human skulls; a wall crawling with huge scarabaeid beetles.  Marion is quite naturally a nervous wreck; she jumps when Indy grabs her suddenly and points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT THEY SEE.  There, coming through the crack in the corner of the next chamber, is white blessed sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy and Marion peek out into the light from the shadows of an abandoned excavation.  Before them is the improvise airstrip serving the digs: a crude runway, a tent supply depot, two fuel tank trucks.  Down by the fuel trucks a German Mechanic is looking skyward.  Now Indy and Marion look there too, drawn by the roaring sound of-- A Flying Wing, which is circling over the digs in prepar- ation to landing. Now a new figure approaches the German Mechanic.  It is Gobler; he yells to the mechanic, indicating the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get is gasses immediately!  It has an important cargo to take out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, the Flying Wing lands and rolls toward the men.  Gobler spins and heads back toward the main cam which is hidden from view by a rise.  Indy and Marion wat him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the Ark gets loaded, we're al- ready going to be on that place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Flying Wing rolls up into the space near the fuel tru The German Mechanic puts blue blocks in front of the tire as the engines continue to roar. Indy and Marion run in a crouch to a hiding spot closer t the plane, near the supply tent.  Suddenly, a Second Germ Mechanic appears behind them.  He is as surprised as they are, but recovers quickly and swings a big monkey wrench at Indy.  Indy grabs the swinging arm and the two men tum ble out into the open, wrestling.  Marion remains hidden, moving fast among the crates. The first German Mechanic, who is just pulling the fuel h from the tank truck to the plane, sees the combatants and runs to help his countryman.  He is almost upon them when Indy puts the Second German away with a devastating left- right--left combination.  He turns to find the first Germ Mechanic flying at him.  The roll toward the rear of the Flying Wing and its lethally spinning reversed propellers In the cockpit of the Flying Wing, the Pilot has been fid dling with his gauges just prior to shutting off his engi Now he notices the fight going on outside. The fistfight between Indy and the German Mechanic has ta on a new stomach-tightening dimension.  The men are fight and flailing in and out between the spinning props at the back of the plane's wings.  Each man comes within inches becoming instant mincemeat. The Pilot slides away the top of his cockpit and stands u He pulls a Luger from his side and points it, waiting for a clear shot at Indy.  The German Mechanic kicks Indy awa from him and the Pilot aims his pistol.  Suddenly, Marion appears behind the Pilot, standing on the opposite wing, and bashes him over the head with one of the blue blocks that was holding the tires.  The Pilot drops down into the cockpit, his body falling on the throttle.  The engin roar louder, revving up.  The plane begins to roll, rotat ing around its one still-blocked set of tires.  Marion gr onto the cockpit to keep from slipping into the props.  S bends into the cockpit, trying to pull the Pilot's body o the throttle.  No luck.  She grimaces and climbs inside. Her shoulder bumps the top of the cockpit; it slides tigh ly shut above her. Under the moving wing, Indy delivers a knockout rightcros to the German Mechanic which sends him staggering back to ward a roaring propeller.  Indy's grimace registers the m demise and a fine mist of blood wafts toward him.  Indy spins toward the sound of crumpling metal and sees-- The other top of the Flying Wing slice into a tank truck. The airplane fuel inside floods out onto the pavement, surrounding the plane.  Indy backpedals away from the pla his eyes searching the scene for Marion.  Suddenly, he is shocked to see her in the cockpit.  He runs toward her, skidding through the gasoline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out!  Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marion is struggling with the top of the cockpit.  She can't budge it.  She's trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three Armed Nazis stand guard around the wooden crate con taining the Ark.  It is sitting near the flopped-open en trance to the Commmand Tent and there is furious activity going on here.  Belloq, Shliemann, Gobler, Belzig and as- sorted Aides are packing up all the papers and personal items in preparation for a hasty departure. A large crowd of Arab Diggers is milling about among the tents.  They all want to get a look at the Ark.  Sallah i among them.  All at once, there is a earthshaking explo- sion.  Al eyes turn toward the rise that hides the air- strip.  A huge fireball floats into view over there.  Eve one starts running toward it.  Shliemann yells at Belzig and the Armed Nazis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay with the Ark!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost all the Arabs and Germans in the digs have congre- gated here and are staring at the burning remains of the Flying Wing.  Belloq and Shliemann arrive just as the sec ond fuel truck blows up.  The concussion knocks many of the observers flat.  Belloq, Shliemann and Gobler watch the scene in alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sabotage!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must get the Ark away from this place immediately!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gobler) Have it put on the truck.  We'll fly out of Cairo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gobler snaps his heels, turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Gobler-- (Gobler stops) -- I want plenty of protection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gobler nods and runs off.  Shliemann heads back toward ca Belloq hesitates a long moment, studying the burning wrec age with an odd, suspicious look.  Finally, he turns and leaves, passing a nearby stack of barrels.  When he has passed, Sallah appears from among the barrels.  He search the crowd for his people and starts a broken field run al some tents to avoid a group of Germans and is running fla out when someone sticks out a leg and sends him flipping. Sallah, dust all over his face, looks angrily toward the concealed culprit.  At once, a flashing white grin splits his darkened face.  Indy and Marion, splotched with soot and oil, are hiding in the flap of a tent.  Sallah runs i to their arms and the three embrace warmly.  When they br

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy smoke, my friends!  I am so pleased you are not dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Us too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly remembering) The Ark!  They're taking it on a truck to Cairo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sallah gestures to follow and all three run off stealthil through the mostly deserted camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sallah, Indy and Marion run into a hiding spot behind som water barrels near the Command Tent.  They peek out at th activity-- In the big space near the Command Tent is parked an open German staff car; inside is a Blond Driver and an Armed Guard.  Directly behind it is a canvas-topped troop truck At this moment, Belloq and Shliemann are supervising the careful placement of the crated Ark in the back of the truck.  When it is securely placed inside, we hear an om- inous marching sound and Nine Armed Nazis appear at a trot from between some tents and climb into the back of t truck with the Ark. Behind the water barrels, Sallah and Marion exchange hape less looks,  But Indy just concentrates on-- The scene by the truck: Belloq and Shliemann are about to climb into the front staff car when they pause to check o the final component of the convoy.  Rolling into place be hind the truck is another open staff car.  But this one i special--mounted in the back is a big, black machine gun, manned by a Gunner.  At the wheel of the car is Gobler an next to him sits Belzig. Sallah and Marion look at Indy.  Belloq and Shliemann cli in  the back seat of the front car and the caravan pulls out.  Indy watches it go, thinking hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two get back to Cairo quick and get us transporation to England-- a plane, a ship, anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to get that truck.  I'll meet you at Omar's.  Be ready for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sallah nods.  Marion looks at him like he's nuts.  Indy j up, looks around desperately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you going to get that truck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still searching) I don't know.  I'm making this up as I go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs away between two tents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From among the tents, Indy suddenly bursts into view, hap pily astride a magnificent white Arabian stallion.  He ga lops off across the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy cuts crosscountry avoiding the road the convoy has taken.  He leaps gullies, climbs dunes, slides down slope Soon the convoy comes into view far below him.  He tears along a parallel ridge, like an Indian shadowing a wagon train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy is entering rougher country.  The narrow moun- tain road we've seen earlier ascends ahead.  To the side of the road are tall boulders.  Suddenly, Indy shoots out from between two rocks and rides directly for the truck. The Armed Nazis in the back of the truck can see nothing because the canvas hides their view.  But Gobler, Belzig and the Gunner in the rear staff car have a brief line on him.  Belzig points and the Gunner fires away and Indy, t bullets kicking up sand near Indy's horse. The Armed Guard in the cab of the truck leans out to see what's happening.  Indy has been riding alongside.  Now he stands on the horse and leaps to the cab.  In a second he has flipped the Armed Guard out of the truck.  He slid into the cab and begins grappling with the Truck Driver. The Truck Driver tries to hit the brakes, but Indy kicks his foot away and floors the gas pedal.  The truck double its speed and shoots onto the steep mountain road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blond Driver of the front staff car sees the truck mo up on him in the rearview mirror and speeds up.  Belloq, Shliemann and the Armed Guard in the car twist around to look at the struggle in the truck.  The Blond Driver begi what will be a continuing preview of the twists in the ro He turns his wheel sharply and takes the lead car around a bend. In the cab of the truck, Indy and the Truck Driver stop their fight temporarily and cooperate in turning the stee ing wheel.  The truck barely stays on the road. A full view reveals the incredible geography of this ride The convoy in tiny against the spectacular mountainside, the cliffs drop hundreds of feet. At the wheel of the rear car, Gobler swerves to stay on the road and accidently sideswipes a boulder.  The Gunner perched in the back is flipped head over heels out of the car.  Gobler and Belzig are having trouble seeing the roa through all the dust the convoy is kicking up. The lead staff car reaches the summit of the road and bar ly makes the hairpin turn there, delivering a destructive blow to the guard rail that has been placed there.  The guard rail is now bent. In the cab of the truck, Indy and the Truck Driver again stop trying to choke each other long enough to negotiate the turn together.  The bumper of the truck hits the bro- ken guard rail and sends it flying off the cliff.  The truck, however, holds the road. In the rear car, Gobler and Belzig are trying to see thro the thick clouds of dust.  Suddenly is clears completely. Unfortunately for them, this happens because their car has shot out into space at the hairpin turn.  They are flying to their final reward.  Belzig, eyes wide behind his evil spectacles, screams as he goes. In the cab of the truck, the Truck Driver is distracted by the sight of the flying staff car.  Indy plasters him and he tumbles out. Far, far below, Belzig's staff car explodes on the rocks. In the back of the truck, a TOUGH SERGEANT takes command of the situation.  He picks out six Armed Nazis and motio for them to start climbing around the outside of the truck to the cab.  With some trepidation the lucky ones begin that maneuver.  The truck is swerving like crazy. In the front staff car, the Armed Guard aims his submachi guns back at Indy, alone now in the truck's cab.  Shliema knocks the barrel roughly away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) If anything happens to that Ark, we're all dead men !  The Fuhrer will see to it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy sees this from the cab and reacts by speeding up, pu ting even more pressure on the Blond Driver. Along the back of the truck, Armed Nazis are edging up to ward the cab, three on each side.  They hang on as the truck rounds a corner and goes into a straightaway that leads through a short tunnel. In the cab, Indy has been concentrating on the lead staff car.  Now, just before entering the tunnel, he looks in the side view mirror and sees the Nazis on his side.  A quick glance to the other mirror reveals the others.  As the truck sweeps into the tunnel, we see Indy just start to turn his steering wheel--he is going to sideswipe the walls of the tunnel At the other end of the tunnel, we hear the roar of the two engine and two long, screeching, scraping sounds.  Th lead staff car shoots out of the tunnel, then the truck, its sides cleaned of Nazis. In the rear of the truck, the Tough Sergeant is looking with distaste back at the tunnel.  There remains only him and two Armed Nazis with the Ark.  He sends these two cli ing up over the top of the truck. In the lead car, the Blond Driver is being pressed hard by Indy, who now edges up to bump them from the rear.  Su denly the Armed Guard next to the Driver sees the two Arm Nazis appear on the top of the truck.  Without thinking, he starts to point them out to Shliemann, then realizes his stupidity. In the cab, Indy has seen this and is at first mystified. He checks his sideview mirrors.  Then he figures it out and slams on his brakes.  The brakes lock, the wheels bur and the truck skids to a dusty halt.  The two Armed Nazis fly off the truck, over the cab to the road in front. Indy immediately hits the gas again.  The two Armed Nazis just aiming their weapons, get wiped out. In the rear of the truck, the crated Ark is bouncing all along, no one in sight, because-- The Tough Sergeant is on the top of the truck, making his way steadily forward.  This guy clearly knows what he's doing.  A submachine gun is slung across his back. The truck and the staff car race through a series of S-curves.  In the staff car, Belloq and Shliemann spot th Tough Sergeant as he reaches the front of the truck's top and begins to lower his submachine gun barrel toward the cab.  Indy is unaware.  Bellow and Shliemann exchange loo Then Shliemann yells to the Armed Guard in the front seat The Tough Sergeant has a line on Indy.  He points his gun The Armed Guard blasts away at the truck.  The Tough Ser- geant dies in a hail of bullets and flies off. Indy, who has ducked at the gunfire, is confused.  But wh he sees the Armed Guard up front lower his gun, Indy agai floors it and begins bumping the staff car in earnest. The road is almost down to a level now.  In the distance- Cairo.  The road takes a little dogleg just before reach- ing level ground again.  Just as the staff car is about t make the turn, Indy smashes them from behind.  The staff car flies off the road and down a twenty foot embankment. Indy takes the truck speeding down the road and off towar Cairo. In the staff car, the occupants are bruised but safe. Shliemann points at the departing truck and yells at the Driver.  The staff car fishtails out of its sandy resting place and takes off after the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy has an ever-decreasing lead on the staff car as the race thunders into the narrow streets.  People and animal leap out of the way; carts and barrels go flying helter skelter.  Indy takes the truck down a street so narrow there are only inches to spare on each side.  Pedestrians jump into doorways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the truck clears the narrow street, it is in a small square.  Omar's garage  s gaping open on the opposite sid Indy hits the brakes and the truck skids across the squar and into the garage.  The garage door slams shut and tent ing drops from the building to hide the door. Various ara friends of Omar, rush out with fruit carts and baskets and set up a mini-bazaar in seconds.  Two Arab Boys sweep the tracks of the truck into obliviion.  They throw aside their brooms just as the staff car appears from the narro street.  Belloq and Shliemann look around desperately as the Blond Driver steers the car through the square and ou the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waterfront is dark and misty.  An old tramp steamer, THE BANTU WIND, sits by the pier.  Several fierce Black African Pirates, the crewmembers, are taking on final stores. A small light illuminates the top of the gangplank.  In its circle, Indy and Marion exchange long, warm embraces with Sallah.  A short distance away the ship's Captain, a handsome, powerful black named SIMON KATANGA, watches fro the rail, smoking a pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bantu Wind is bathed in moonlight as it cuts across even seas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy comes in, takes off his hat, jacket, whip and holste The door which connects this cabin to the next opens and Marion appears.  She is carrying a half-full glass of liquor, but what you notice is the long, snow-white, high necked nightgown she is wearing.  It is very prim.  Very innocent.  And very sexy.  Marion does a slightly embarra model's turn for Indy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a feeling I'm not the first woman to travel with these pirates. There's a whole wardrobe in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy sits on the cot, takes off his boots.  He leans back against the wall and rubs his eyes.  Marion sits on the bed, leans back against the wall with him and looks down at her white nightgown.  She chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like a virgin bride in this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you look like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes a drink) There are some things you can recap- ture in this life, but that isn't one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you like to recapture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a long pause) Nothing.  That is the way it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches her closely as she drains her glass and puts it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I ever say I was sorry I burned down your tavern?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns so their lips are very close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Then again, I burned up that plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you saved mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems things have worked out kind of even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the way I like them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should consider all past accounts closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marion thinks about this a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks into his eyes.  A smile jumps from her lips to his.  He kisses her and they sink slowly to the cot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship's rats are agitated.  They tremble and chitter at the edges of the compartment, darting about.  Out in the center of the hold, sitting all by itself, is the crated Ark.   HUM-M-M-M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marion awakes with a start, alone in the cot.  Something' wrong.  The ship is quiet.  Indy is strapping on his hols He pulls his ship and jacket from a hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engines have shut down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy runs toward the bow, then climbs some steps four at a time.  A MESSENGER PIRATE is hurrying to get him, but flies by him on the steps.  By the time the Pirate stops himself, Indy is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Jones!  The Captain he say--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Katanga is looking with concern ahead of the ship Indy appears behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have most important friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katanga turns quickly, pointing with a sweeping hand.  In looks.  Arrayed in a rough semicircle around the ship are ten German Wolf Submarines.  All of their deck guns are manned and trained on the Bantu Wind.  Worse, at least fi heavily-armed boarding parties in rafts are closing quick on the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fast) I sent my man for you.  You and the girl must disappear.  We have a place in the hold.  Go, my friend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy tears along the deck. He looks over the rail and sees two Nazi rafts already next to the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy flies down some stairs and starts to round a corner. Suddenly he throws himself backwards, out of view.  Three uniformed Nazis are clustered near a cabin door holding the Messenger Pirate.  Now two more come out of the cabin trying to maintain their grasp on a kicking, yelling Mari She is still wearing her white nightgown.  More Nazis cla ber onto the deck and head toward Indy, slamming open doo rousting Pirates, spouting racial epithets.  Indy steps backwards and fades into the maze of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship is swarming with Nazis.  The Black Pirates are herded forward, subjected to rough physical and verbal abuse by the Aryan Supermen.  The Pirates are clearly under orders not to resist, but not one of these strong men likes it.  They'd gladly give their lives to rip the throat out of a few Krauts.  In the hold, the door slams open and Nazis pour in; they smile at the sight of the crated Ark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Katanga watches as his crew is crowded into a cir cle of Nazis on the wide deck below him.  He is surrounde by Belloq, Shliemann, and several Nazis, two of whom are holding Marion.  Now the Nazis from the hold appear on th lower deck carrying the crated Ark by means of the long poles.  Belloq's eyes shine at the sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it aboard the Wurrfler!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And be very careful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ark is taken away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to a Sergeant below) What about Jones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a trace yet, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belloq and Shliemann regard him suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We killed him.  He was of no use to us.  The girl, however, has certain value where we are headed.  She will bring a very good price.  If that cargo you have taken was your goal, then go in peace with it.  But leave us the girl.  It will reduce our loss on this trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Savage.  You are not in a position to ask for anything.  We will take what we wish and then decide whether or not to slow your ship from the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belloq steps forward and puts a proprietory hand on Mario arm, fixing Shliemann with a steady look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That girl goes with me.  It will be part of my compensation.  I'm sure the Fuhrer would approve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shliemann considers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she fails to please me, you can do with her as you wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This appeals to Shliemann's nature.  He signals his agree ment with a gesture.  Belloq ushers Marion away with her two keepers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nazis have returned to their subs.  Shliemann is on the bridge with THE WURRFLER'S CAPTAIN and the Captain's Aides.  The Captain is an honorable career Navy man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Shliemann, all torpedoes are loaded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shliemann nods and continues to stare at the Bantu Wind, as does the Captain.  The Pirate crew is all lined across the bow.  Towering above the others, standing on the rail proud and defiant, is Katanga.  Shliemann looks at the Wurrfler's Captain a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (earnestly) I think not, Colonel.  Nothing is to be gained.  We are not at war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shliemann mulls this, then turns to the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...yet.  Let the vermin live.  We must be on our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shliemann disappears down the hatch.  The Captain is very pleased.  A Radioman speaks into his headset, then follow the other Aides down the hatch.  In the distance the othe subs begin to move away from the ship.  The Captain, alon on the bridge, looks once more at Katanga. On the Bantu Wind, Katanga executes what might be taken for a salute. The Wurrfler's Captain smiles, salutes crisply, then goes below, pulling the hatch closed.  Immediately, the Wurrfl begins to move.  And as it does, we see the rail at the a of the main deck.  From nowhere, a wet sleeve appears and a hand grabs the rail! Indy pulls his dripping body onto the sub's main deck.  H has lost his felt hat once and for all.  Other than that, his outfit is the same as always, just wetter.  Suddenly, water is washing over his feet; the Wurrfler is beginning to submerge.  Indy runs through quickly deepening water toward the haven of the conning tower.  Halfway there, he slips and goes down.  Only by grabbing the base of the aftmast light does he keep from being swept away.  He str gles to his feet and sloshes through knee-deep water to t base of the conning tower. Indy climbs the ladder to the bridge of the conning tower and looks down.  The water is rising toward his fast.  In climbs the ladder to the top of the turret and braces him self between the two uprights there--the 7 foot radio mas and the 20 foot periscope.  Still the ocean comes up to meet him.  Soon the top of the turret is under water and the radio mast is disappearing.  Indy shifts his grip to the periscope, working his way up it and hanging on for dear life as the ocean whips at his body.  The periscope quickly going under.  Indy hangs on to the top three feet all that remains above. The forward movement of the sub continues, but, to Indy's slowly dawning delight, the dive stops.  No more of the periscope goes under.  Indy smiles; it's a pretty good smile, too, given the circumstances.  Indy pulls out his bullwhip and begins  tying himself to the periscope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun warms that part of his body Indy has contrived to keep out of the water.  The rest floats out behind.  Indy isn't comfortable, but all in all, it's not as terrible as he might have feared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's as terrible as Indy might have feared.  He looks wasted.  Waterlogged and exhausted.  The wet leather of the whip is contracting and he must struggle constantly to keep it from cutting into his skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several shark fins cut the surface, appearing and disap- pearing in the bright moonlight.  They are shadowing--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy looks through barely open eyes at the sharks running alongside.  There is nothing to be done.  His eyes close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The submarine has stopped.  The water is calm.  The moon is bright.  A gentle swell splashes Indy awake.  He blink tries to regain his senses.  He makes an inventory of his body.  Surprised to find himself intact, his spirits lift Some hidden reserve of energy flows through him.  He free his aching arms from the wet leather of his whip, leaving only one loop around his waist to hold him to the sub.  H rubs his hands and stretches.  Once again, he has survive To fight again.  He looks around. WHAT HE SEES.  A lovely island.  No sign of man's presenc The sub has stopped at the mouth of a wide cove completel ringed by tall white rock cliffs.  Suddenly the sub begin to move again.  It is headed directly toward the center o the cliffs.  Indy holds on, mystified, alert.  When the cliffs are very close, the sub begins to dive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks hard.  Inspiration hits just before the water. Indy flips his leather jacket up over his head and holds the jacket out in front of him.  His head is hidden by th jacket as he goes under water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sub enters an underwater tunnel that penetrates into the cliffs.  Indy is held to the periscope by his crossed legs and the whip.  His impromptu air bubble is working, but it's a struggle to maintain it. The sub begins to cut through think marine vegetation. Each dangling growth pulls at Indy's body and slaps at hi leather bubble.  Now a clump of entwined seaweed rips the leather out of his hands and his bubble of air rises away Indy hangs on, holding his breath, but the vegetation get denser.  Finally, it pulls him off the periscope.  The sub moves on, disappearing ahead. Indy rises desperately through the dark water, his hand outstretched.  Then, almost simultaneously, hand and head hit solid rock.  But no air.  Indy feels along the ceilin of rock.  Nothing.  It's all submerged. Indy dives, stroking deep into the tunnel.  When he has descended 15 feet, he grabs a vine and steadies himself. His eyes search the dim roof of the tunnel.  He sees his last hope in the distance--a small blue circle, an air pocket.  He swims for it. In the air pocket, Indy's head breaks the surface and smashes into rock again.  The pocket is only six inches deep.  No matter.  Indy loves it.  He'd like to move in. He gulps air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wurrfler has arrived at an extraordinary base built in the hollow interior of the island.  This chamber, with the docking bay, is almost all water.  A huge natural cav ern, it has been reinforced and enlarged by the Germans. The Wurrfler sits surfaced at the dock.  The Ark has been unloaded and placed on a cart.  Shliemann, Belloq and Mar have just disembarked and been met by a Nazi contingent from the base.  Marion looks worse for the trip. Her whit nightgown is now ripped and smudged. One of the greeting Nazis, a TALL CAPTAIN, salutes Shlie- mann and Belloq.  As he speaks to them, we notice that ri behind this group, just above a great deal of sub unloadi activity, Indy's whip hangs from the periscope. Working Nazis pass within feet of it unaware; the Tall Captain wo see it in a moment if he were not so focused on the new arrivals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Belloq) The tents have been arranged in accor- dance with your radioed instructions, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  We must take the Ark there now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shliemann looks a little unhappy about this exchange, but says nothing.  The group moves swiftly toward the end of a mine train arrangement.  The train, consisting of small, separate, electric-powered cars, sits on a trac which disappears into a tunnel cut in the rock. On the turret of the Wurrfler, the Wurrfler's Captain lig a cigarette as he watches the mine train disappear, then returns his attention to the activity on the dock.  He le idly against the periscope, his head two feet below Indy' dangling whip.  Something catches his eye, he yells an or der and climbs down from the turret to deal with the matt We hold on the whip for a long moment, until its owner's hand appears and quickly reclaims it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ark and its entourage are moving slowly up the tight dark tunnel, their way lit by intermittent lanterns.  The tunnel is irregular, but generally about 7 feet wide.  It height varies from an average of about 7 feet to a low of only about 4.5 feet at the points (every 40 feet) where s port beams cross the track.  The result is that there is only about a foot of clearance above the mine cars at tho points; passengers must duck to keep from being hit in th head.  Shliemann, looking worried, and Belloq, very excit are focused on the Ark in the car ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am uncomfortable with the thought of this-- (spitting it out ) --Jewish ritual. Are you sure it's necessary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
