dialogues.text: (playing him) Let me ask you this--Would you be more comfortable opening the Ark in Berlin--for the Fuhrer--and finding out only them if the sacred pieces of the Covenant are inside?  Knowing, only then, whether you have accom- plished your mission and obtained the one, true Ark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shliemann doesn't like any of his alternatives.  He looks Belloq with some suspicion as the train comes into bright

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second natural cavern, even bigger than the first, has worked over by the Germans into a rectangular, three-stor high supply center around a huge, open, center court.  Un formed Nazi Soldiers are everywhere, wrangling supplies a ammunition, monitoring electronic equipment.  At the far of the court, a second train tunnel disappears into the r Across the open court, Belloq sees his destination: a lar brilliant white silk tent has been erected in the midst o all this hardware.  It looks incongruous, and more than a little eerie.  It is the Tabernacle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy is making his way up the tunnel.  He hears cars comi from up ahead and steps into the shadows.  A mine car pas with several laughing Nazis.  Indy continues on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light in here is lovely, unearthly.  Oil lamps burn. The Tabernacle is really several concentric, silk tents, which creates a flowing maze effect.  The innermost tent has at its center a 3-foot high, tapestry-covered altar. Belloq watches with gleaming, obsessed eyes as two Nazis carefully lift the actual Ark out of its crate by means of the long poles.  The Ark dazzles the eye, seeming to glow gold in this strange light.  The two Nazis place it carefully on the altar.  Shliemann and some Aides hang back. Marion is nowhere to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy makes a fast break from the shadows of the tunnel to the protection of a high stack of supplies.  He climbs th back of the stack, peeks over and surveys the area. WHAT HE SEES.  In addition to the Tabernacle, the second train tunnel entrance, and all the activity, Indy's glanc rests momentarily on a large, heavy metal door halfway down one wall toward the Tabernacle.  It bears the words, in German:  DANGER - MUNITIONS. Indy continues to scan the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the central area with the Ark, Shliemann and the other Nazis wait impatiently, eyeing the Ark with some discom- fort.  Belloq is not visible, because at the moment he is In the folds of the Tabernacle, the silk of the tents un- dulating around him.  The light is even stranger, the sce almost dreamlike.  With the help of the Tall Captain, Bel lets an extraordinary, gold-embroidered, ceremonial robe fall over his head and onto his body.  Belloq looks trans ported, possessed.  The Tall Captain unlatches a wooden c and takes from it a sturdy ivory rod about 5 feet long, e orately engraved.  Belloq takes it from him, turns and sl back through the silk.  The Tall Captain stays in the fol Back in the central area, Shliemann and the other Nazis a taken aback by Belloq's appearance in the robe.  They ex- change looks.  From one knot of men there is muttering ab "Juden" and such, but when Belloq turns a fiery gaze on t there is immediate silence.  Shliemann looks uncertain in this presence. Bellow approaches the Ark.  He stops a few feet from it a begins murmuring an invocation in Hebrew.  After a few mo ments of this he advances a step and is about to place th ivory rod in a notch under the lid of the Ark itself.  Th end of the rod is an inch from the notch when-- Indy steps into the Tabernacle.  On his shoulder is a ba- zooka and it is aimed directly at the Ark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it. (the Nazi react) One move from anybody and I blow that box back to Moses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shliemann makes it clear to the other Nazis that Indy is to be obeyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones, your persistence surprises even me.  You are going to give mercenaries a bad name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?  Talked to God yet? (Belloq's eyes flash) Where's the girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Jones, surely you don't think you can escape from this base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That depends on how reasonable we're all willing to be.  All I want is the girl.  We'll keep possession of the Ark only till we've got safe transport to England.  Then it's all your.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we refuse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the Ark and some of us are go- ing up in a big bang.  I don't think Hitler would like that a bit.  Now I don't want to talk about this any- more.  Show me that girl in five seconds or--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tall Captain flies out of the silk and takes Indy dow by the neck.  The bazooka clatters across the cement floo as two other Nazis help subdue Indy.  The three Nazis tak Indy's pistol from his holster and raise him roughly in their grasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones, this is the second time I have seen you looking very foolish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bad habit.  I'm trying to break it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shliemann draws his Luger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll help you.  This time I'll kill you myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shliemann raises the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Not in the presence of the Ark! Take him outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shliemann eyes Belloq, then the Ark.  He lowers the pisto motions for the Nazis to take Indy out ahead of him.  The stop a moment only when Belloq speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indiana Jones, I salute you.  I am even a little sorry you will miss this moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  If you talk to Him, tell Him I'm on my way up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shliemann motions them out and follows.  Belloq turns bac to the Ark, raising the ivory rod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shliemann, the Tall Captain, Indy and the two Nazis hold- ing him emerge from the Tabernacle.  Shliemann points to a nearby wall and the group starts that way with Shlie- mann and the Tall Captain slightly ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belloq has the ivory rod inserted in the notch under the lid of the Ark.  He utters a short phrase in Hebrew and begins to press down on his end of the rod.  The lid of the Ark begins to lift.  It's difficult work.  Belloq put his whole weight into one big press on his end and the lid opens two feet. Inside the Ark of the Covenant is a preview of the end of the world.  A light so bright, a power so fearsome, a charge so jolting, that there is nothing in our world to compare to it.  It's as though this magnificent golden box has been gathering electric energy for three thousand years, waiting for just this crack of the lid to release it all in one fast, cleansing explosion of pure force. Blinding arcs of light shoot out across the Tabernacle instantly killing all the Nazis inside and turning the white silk to flame.  But it is Belloq in his obsession who takes the full blast.  His whole body seems lit by a million volt current and, for amoment, his complete form is white, then blue, then maybe green, but it is hard to tell because our eyes are blinded now too.  Two aspects of this ghastly, beautiful display are somehow communicated in the chaos, although the communication is subliminal.  First, that Belloq, in the instant of his destruction, has experienced some kind of sublime, transcendental knowledge.  If a death's-head can smile an look satisfied, that is how Belloq's incandescent face would be described.  Secondly, this event is accompanied by a sound like no other.  A sound so intense and so odd and so haunting that the suggestible among us might im- agine it were the whisper of God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choas.  Shliemann and the Tall Captain have been tempo- rarily blinded by the light from the Tabernacle.  Indy makes short work of his two escorts.  He bashes their heads together.  When only one goes down at this, Indy uses the handle of his bullwhip, which has appeared in- stantly in his hand, to put the second one down. Shliemann, hand on his eyes, aims his Luger blindly at the scuffle.  Indy pushes the Tall Captain at Shliemann, who fires on impact, killing the Tall Captain.  Indy knoc out Shliemann. Behind Indy, the brilliant light and weird noise of the Ark have suddenly ceased, but the Tabernacle is ablaze and the fire has quickly apread to stacks of supplies on either side.  Smoke is already starting to fill the caver Nazis are running around, yelling for firefighting water. A burning crate at the side of the Tabernacle is pushed over, only to knock over a drum of heavy black oil.  A river of flame shoots across the cement. Indy grabs a rifle with bayonet from the prostrate body of one of his former escorts and runs back into the flami Tabernacle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy jumps through the flames into what is now a tent of fire.  He looks around at the dead bodies, then at the Ar The lid has slammed down shut again and the Ark shines go in the flames.  Before it, where Belloq once stood, is a pile of ash and charred debris.  Indy registers this, the continues to scan the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marion!  Marion, can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Indy looks as-- The far side of the Tabernacle burns completely away, re- vealing Marion, tied spread-eagle between two upright pos Her nightgown is now in tatters, black with soot.  She is gagged, but her eyes are screaming, focused on the flamin river of black oil which is about to engulf her feet. Indy rushes toward her, unaware of a uniformed Nazi who has appeared from the flames.  Marion looks up to see Indy and the Nazi leveling his submachine gun at Indy. She motions desperately with her eyes.  Indy dives and rolls through the flames just as the Nazi opens fire. From the floor, Indy blasts the Nazi. The river of burning oil is only a foot from Marion. Indy jumps up and runs toward the bound Marion, his bayo- net aimed directly at her.  Her wide eyes flash between the flames and the shining balde.  Ecpertly, Indy slashes down both sides at Marion, cutting all four bindings.  Ma ion falls backwards, away from the flames, but before she hits the ground, Indy is there, catching her in his arms. They embrace.  They kiss.  They break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Indy!  Thank god you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad I could make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy rises, pulling her up with him.  The Tabernacle is burning away so fast that soon Indy and Marion will be completely exposed.  Indy rushes over and grabs the sub- machine gun and a Luger from the dead Nazi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the Ark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ondy stops, startled by her spunky attitude.  He's con- sidering their changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yes!  We've made it this far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins at her) Okay.  Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach the altar through the dying flames, Indy slinging the submachine gun over hsi back.  The long carrying poles are still in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you do, don't touch it. Let's put it on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marion nods.  Each taking an end with the poles, they lif the Ark from the altar and lower it to the floor.  Marion grunts under the weight.  Indy registers this, hands her the submachine gun.  He pulls out hsi whip, motions her back, and sweeps the whip tightly around the body of the Ark.  The fall wraps snugly around the plaiting and Indy ties it off.  The Ark is now harnessed to the whip handle Indy gives it an experimental pull and the Ark slides acr the smooth cement.  Indy indicates the direction of the second train tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll go down that side.  Shoot any- one who looks at us crosseyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two huge stacks of goods are ablaze and the Nazis are hav trouble getting water to them.  The Nazis main concern at this point is an enormous, neat stack of wooden cartridge boxes which are piled down the wall from one of the alrea blazing, and now teetering, stacks of general goods.  Ner vous Nazis are moving the heavy cartridge boxes as fast a they can, but it's slow work and the threatening fire is close. Indy and Marion make their way along the side of the cent court, Indy grimacing with the strain of pulling the Ark. One Nazi stops directly in front of them, looking at them queerly.  Indy knocks his out with the butt of his Luger just as Marion is about to fire. Out in the court, Shliemann has regained his eyesight.  N he crouches, scanning the scene desperately for Indy.  He looks into the remains of the Tabernacle and spots the em altar.  Beyond it, the unoccupied posts where Marion was bound. At the entrance to the second train tunnel, Indy and Mari struggle to lift the Ark into a mine car.  Marion has the submachine gun slung over her back.  The Ark drops heavil into the bottom of the car.  The noise attracts the atten of five water-carrying Nazis.  They see what's going on a reach for their side-arms. Indy grabs Marion, pulls her i front of him--as though to use her as a shield--and flips the submachine gun, still on her back, toward the Nazis. He opens fire, turning Marion's body so he can mow all five down. Shliemann spins around and looks at the tunnel entrance. He points at Indy and Marion, who have just hopped into t mine car with the Ark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop them!  Kill them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen Nazis spin and look at the mine car.  Marion is j leveling the submachine gun.  Indy pushes forward the thr and the mine car moves toward the tunnel, picking up spee As the Nazis raise their guns to fire, Marion and Indy bo open up, peppering the area with lead.  As the mine car i about to disappear into the tunnel--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Marion) Get down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the car disappears, bullets pock the entrance of the tunnel.  Shliemann runs up with three Nazis.  They jump into the next mine car and take off, disappearing into the tunnel. Over at the burning stack of goods, some terrified fire- fighters scurry away as the burning pile of general goods falls over onto the stack of cartridge boxes.  The wooden boxes immediately start burning.  Many of the Nazis just want to get out of there, but a couple of disciplined OF- FICERS are trying to salvage the situation.  They point t the far side of the court, the walls are lines with oil and gas drums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must cover the drums!  Protect them from the bullets!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 149    INTERCUTTING Indy and Marion with Shliemann and th we see a most extraordinary pursuit.  This tunnel is of identical design to the first, except more twisty.  This early section goes slightly uphill, as though headed for the summit of a rollercoaster.  The low cross beams and the higher sections in between are causing the Nazis to alternately stand and duck in their efforts to get a clear shot at the lead car.  One German times it wrong an gets whacked.  Indy in unhappy with the speed of his car and he's right, the Nazis are moving faster and gaining. When both cars are in the same high section, the Nazis bl away at them.  The noise is deafening, with barking guns, splintering rock, and twanging ricochets contributing to the din.  As Marion fires a return volley low over the Ar Indy kicks at the throttle, convinced it is jammed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officers are directing the placement of every move- able item in front of the oil drums.  Desks, crates, chai food, all are heaped in front of the fuel. All the worker cast frequent nervous glances back at the burning cartrid boxes across the court.  Suddenly the worst begins to hap pen at the cartridge boxes.  Hundreds of thousands of liv cartridges begin exploding, flying around the court like shrapnel.  Hot lead begins to zing off the exposed fuel drums, leaving big dents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car with Indy and Marion looks almost sluggish com- pared to the pursuing Nazi car as they both make their wa into an usually long straightaway.  Marion discards her empty submachine gun as Indy kicks at his throttle and ca a worried look back at Shliemann. Shliemann, sensing victory, smiles evilly and carefully takes aim.  Indy and Marion will be easy targets until th reach that approaching low cross beam, which is the crest of the rising tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: FUEL DRUM
dialogues.text: A fuel drum, already pocked by bullets is finally pene- trated by high velocity hot lead.  It explodes in a ball of flame.  And then its neighbor.  Then all is exploding flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shliemann and his cohorts hear the explosions behind them and look back that way. Indy kicks the throttle one more time and it goes!  Their car doubles its speed and shoots under the low cross beam at the same instant as-- A huge dragon of all-consuming fire shoots up the tunnel behind the Nazis, catches their car and incinerates Shliemann and his men.  The tunnel collapses in this sect burying the fried Nazis forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy and Marion look back at the low cross beam as the la tongue of flame makes it there and then is doused by fall rock and dirt.  They look at each other, then turn their attention back to their own predicament.  Their mine car going incredible fast as it moves into a downward section of wildly twisting tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow it down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy is already pulling the throttle.  It moves easily. Unfortunately, it is no longer attached to the motor.  Th mine car is out of control.  After several moments, far ahead, appears a circle of bright daylight-- the end of t tunnel!  It approaches at a frightening rate.  Indy reach out and grasps Marion's hand.  They exchange looks and th turn to look ahead. THEIR POV.  We're taking this last stretch with them.  It a familiar nightmare.  It has to do with a rollercoaster that ends suddenly and disastrously.  The shocking bright ness of sunlight rushes up to engulf us, blinding us in its glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High up on the slope of the island, Indy and Marion's min car shoots out of the black tunnel and roars down toward a little dock at the end of the tracks. A small Nazi transport launch, carefully disguised as a Greek fishing boat, sits bobbing by the dock.  The only human:  a Nazi Sentry dressed as a Greek peasant.  He is perched on a pile of seed bags which are stacked at the very end of the train tracks.  As the mine car barrels noisily down toward him, he throws away some burlap to reveal a mounted machine gun which he spins quickly aroun toward the approaching mine car.  He opens fire. In the out-of-control mine car, Indy pulls Marion down wi him.  They are squashed into the corner trying to avoid c tact with the bounching Ark.  Bullets clang against the o side of the car and whiz inches overhead.  Indy and Mario are forced into a tighter and tighter embrace of life. At the machine gun post, the Nazi Sentry has been firing like crazy, but now there is terror in his eyes.  He realizes the car is not going to stop.  He lacks faith in his stronghold.  Too late. The mine car smashes into the seed bag bunker.  And right on through.  The Nazi Sentry, his machine gun and a dozen bursting seed bags are slammed into the ocean in a wild, hurtling mass.  The mine car jumps, bounces and spins aro then slides to a stop in a cloud of seed at the edge of t water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire.  Everywhere.  No sign of life.  A large gaping door way, flames ringing it, blazing into the room beyond.  Ha ing by one hinge there, its metal blasted and jagged, is heavy door with the signed lettering, in German, DANGER - MUNITIONS. The first explosion happens.  It's a baby compared to wha coming yet is rocks the earth.  It's terrible.  And then, almost immediately, another.  The long, irregular, ever- larger chain of explosions begins.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The island rumbles and shakes.  From fissures and small natural caves, dirt and rock shoot out like spraying wate Still the explosion continue.  A huge chuck of white clif falls away into the turbulent sea.  Birds scream and soar afraid to land. Finally, we settle on a full shot of the island.  We can recognize that the small opening high on the slope from which a cloud of smoke and dust is billowing is the end of the mine tunnel.  And there below it, quite small from this distance is the dock.  And the boat that looks like a Greek fishing boat.  There can be no mistake even from this far away--the boat is chugging out to sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy, Brody, and Marion, looking very stylish, are seated in Colonel Musgrove's huge office.  Sun pours in a window through which Washington can be seen sparkling across the Potomac.  Everything is neat and clean and regular.  In- cluding the three men who are arrayed around the office. Two we know--Col. Musgrove and Maj. Eaton.  The third is an unnamed Bureaucrat.  He hangs back, smiling and genial his features obscured by the glare of the window.  He doe say anything, yet you have a sense that the others defer him in the matter at hand.  He is the essence of all that is Byzantine and inscrutable in our scrubbed government machine. Indy and Brody are dissatisfied with the way the meeting has gone.  Marion, on the other hand, is very happy and eager to get out of there.  Eaton's manner is irritatingl cheery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've done your country a great service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --And we trust you found the settle- ment satisfactory?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, good. (glances around at the others) Then I guess that about does it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When can we have the Ark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eaton's glance flicks over to the mysterious Bureaucrat, then back to Brody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we answered that.  It's someplace very safe--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heated) That's a powerful force.  Research should be done--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it will be, Dr. Jones, I assure you.  We have top men working on it right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy exchanges a look with Brody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We may be able to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We appreciate that.  And we won't hesitate to call on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissing them) Thank you all.  Thank you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy looks them over coldly.  He gets up, sullen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy, Brody and Marion emerge from the building.  Brody bids them farewell and moves off in another direction. Marion clings to Indy's arm in an energetic, very feminin way, scolding him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Well they aren't going to tell you, so why don't you just forget it.  I'd think you'd has enough of that damn Ark.  Just put your mind on something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indy stops, looking across the river, his mind occupied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marion makes a face, then puts her arms around his neck and plants a humdinger of a kiss on his mouth.  It goes on a while.  Finally they break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the Ark...but it'll have to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move down the steps, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ark of the Covenant sits in a wooden crate.  A wooden lid comes down and hides it from view.  The lid is solidl nailed to the crate as we read the stenciled message on t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hammering is completed and hands shift the heavy crat onto a dolly.

dialogues.speaker: THE END CREDITS ROLL AS WE SEE--
dialogues.text: A Little Old Government Warehouseman begin pushing the crated Ark down as aisle.  Soon we see that the aisle is formed by huge stacks or crates.  They come in many shape and sizes, but when it comes right down to it, they all look like the one that holds the Ark.  All have markings like the message we've just seen.  Pretty soon we're far enough and high enough away from the Little Old Governmen Warehouseman to see that this is one of the biggest rooms in the world.  And it is full.  Crates and crates.  All looking alike.  All gathering dust. And then we notice that the Little Old Government Ware- houseman, pushing his new crate ahead of him, has turned into another aisle and disappeared from view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This script was found in INFlow. It was shameless taken o else, may god, copyright owners and people who worked har credited forgive us.
